title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
summary: A woman dissatisfied with her life is transported to a mysterious library between life and death where she explores alternate versions of her choices and learns what truly matters.

title: It Ends With Us
author: Colleen Hoover
summary: A young woman must confront her past and fight her way out of a destructive relationship while reclaiming her strength and autonomy.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
summary: An astronaut wakes up far from Earth with no memory of his mission and must rely on ingenuity and a surprising ally to save humanity.

title: Before the Coffee Gets Cold
author: Toshikazu Kawaguchi
summary: Customers at a small Tokyo cafe are offered a chance to travel back in time—if only for one seat, one drink, one chance to say what they left unsaid.

title: The Song of Achilles
author: Madeline Miller
summary: A re-imagining of the Trojan War focusing on the deep, tragic love story between the demigod Achilles and the exiled prince Patroclus.

title: Tomorrow and Tomorrow and Tomorrow
author: Gabrielle Zevin
summary: A story of two childhood friends who become video game designers, exploring their complex relationship over decades of creation, success, and failure.

title: Klara and the Sun
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
summary: An 'Artificial Friend' designed to be a companion for children observes the human world and explores the meaning of love, sacrifice, and humanity.

title: Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine
author: Gail Honeyman
summary: A socially isolated woman’s structured life is upended by an unexpected friendship with a coworker, forcing her to confront her traumatic past.

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
summary: A magical competition between two young illusionists unfolds within an enchanted circus that appears only at night, binding them in a dangerous game of love and destiny.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
summary: A mythic retelling following the sorceress Circe as she defies gods, tames beasts, and discovers her own power and identity in a world ruled by men.

title: A Man Called Ove
author: Fredrik Backman
summary: An irritable widower’s meticulously planned solitude is disrupted by a boisterous new family next door, leading to unexpected friendships and a new lease on life.

title: Lessons in Chemistry
author: Bonnie Garmus
summary: A 1950s scientist-turned-TV-chef upends expectations, challenges the patriarchy, and teaches her audience about chemistry and life.

title: The House in the Cerulean Sea
author: TJ Klune
summary: A rigid social worker is sent to a remote orphanage for magical children, where he discovers a found family, love, and the courage to stand up for them.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
summary: A reclusive Old Hollywood movie icon decides to tell her life story to an unknown magazine reporter, revealing glamorous, scandalous, and heartbreaking truths.

title: Beautiful World Where Are You
author: Sally Rooney
summary: Four young friends in Ireland navigate love, friendship, and existential anxieties about their future and the state of the world.

title: People We Meet on Vacation
author: Emily Henry
summary: Two best friends with nothing in common except their annual summer vacation attempt one last trip to see if they can finally bridge the gap between friendship and love.

title: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue
author: V.E. Schwab
summary: A woman makes a Faustian bargain to live forever but is cursed to be forgotten by everyone she meets, until 300 years later she finds someone who remembers her.

title: Book Lovers
author: Emily Henry
summary: A high-powered literary agent and a rival editor, both rivals in the city, are thrown together in a small town and discover their own story might be a romance.

title: Remarkably Bright Creatures
author: Shelby Van Pelt
summary: A grieving widow working at an aquarium befriends a giant Pacific octopus who helps her unravel a mystery about her son's disappearance.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
summary: A young Andalusian shepherd travels the world in search of a treasure, learning about listening to his heart, following his destiny, and understanding the 'Soul of the World'.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
summary: Two people from different backgrounds in small-town Ireland navigate a complex, intimate connection as they move through university and into early adulthood.

title: One Last Stop
author: Casey McQuiston
summary: A cynical 20-something falls for a mysterious, charming girl on the NYC subway, only to discover her new crush is literally displaced in time from the 1970s.

title: A Little Life
author: Hanya Yanagihara
summary: Four college friends move to New York, tracing their complex relationships over decades as they grapple with ambition, love, and the profound trauma of their pasts.

title: Fourth Wing
author: Rebecca Yarros
summary: A young woman is forced to join a deadly dragon-riding war college, where she must survive brutal trials, political intrigue, and a dangerous romance.

title: Babel
author: R.F. Kuang
summary: A Chinese orphan studies translation and magic at Oxford in the 1830s, grappling with colonialism, identity, and the price of revolution.

title: Pachinko
author: Min Jin Lee
summary: A sprawling generational saga following a Korean family who immigrates to Japan, facing prejudice, poverty, and sacrifice over decades.

title: The Priory of the Orange Tree
author: Samantha Shannon
summary: An epic fantasy following a queen without an heir, a dragon rider, and a mage as they unite against an ancient, world-ending evil.

title: Beach Read
author: Emily Henry
summary: Two rival authors with writer's block swap genres for the summer and end up confronting their pasts and falling in love.

title: Daisy Jones and The Six
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
summary: The rise and fall of a fictional 1970s rock band is recounted through a series of interviews, detailing the explosive chemistry and rivalries that tore them apart.

title: Norwegian Wood
author: Haruki Murakami
summary: A student in 1960s Tokyo looks back on his relationships with two very different women as he navigates love, loss, and mental health.
